Field.Description: The command ID number 0x0801

An integer telling the status of the command. This value is
  updated by the radio CPU during operation and may be read by the
  system CPU at any time.
Pointer to the next operation to run after this operation is done
Absolute or relative start time (depending on the value of startTrigger)

BitField.BitDescription: The type of trigger

0: No alternative trigger command
1: CMD_TRIGGER can be used as an alternative trigger
The trigger number of the CMD_TRIGGER command that triggers this action

0: A trigger in the past is never triggered, or for start of commands, give an error
1: A trigger in the past is triggered as soon as possible

Field.Description: Identification of the trigger that starts the operation

BitField.BitDescription: Condition for running next command: Rule for how to proceed
Number of skips + 1 if the rule involves skipping. 0: same, 1: next, 2: skip next, ...

Field.Description:
The main mode to use
0x00: BLE
0x01: IEEE 802.15.4
0x02: 2 Mbps GFSK
0x05: 5 Mbps coded 8-FSK
0xFF: Keep existing mode; update overrides only
Others: Reserved

LO divider setting to use. Supported values: 0, 2, 4,
  5, 6, 10, 12, 15, and 30.

BitField.BitDescription:
0x00: Differential mode
0x01: Single-ended mode RFP
0x02: Single-ended mode RFN
0x05 Single-ended mode RFP with external frontend control on RF pins (RFN and RXTX)
0x06 Single-ended mode RFN with external frontend control on RF pins (RFP and RXTX)
Others: Reserved

0: Internal bias
1: External bias

0x00: Write analog configuration.
Required first time after boot and when changing frequency band or front-end configuration
0x2D: Keep analog configuration.
May be used after standby or when changing mode with the same frequency band and front-end configuration
Others: Reserved

0: Power up frequency synth
1: Do not power up frequency synth

0: Normal synth mode
1: Narrow-band synth mode

Field.Description: Configuration options
Transmit power

Pointer to a list of hardware and configuration registers to override. If NULL, no
  override is used.

BitField.BitDescription: Condition for running next command: Rule for how to proceed
Number of skips + 1 if the rule involves skipping. 0: same, 1: next, 2: skip next, ...

Operation to perform
0: True if value == compareVal
1: True if value < compareVal
2: True if value > compareVal
3: Reserved

If 1, interchange the four bytes of the value, so that they are read
  most-significant-byte-first.
If 1, perform bit reversal of the value

0: Treat value and compareVal as unsigned
1–31: Treat value and compareVal as signed, where the value gives the number of the most significant bit in the signed number.

0: Use pValue as a pointer
1: Use pValue as a signed offset to the start of the last committed RX entry element

Field.Description: Options for comparison
Pointer to next operation if comparison result was true
Pointer to read from, or offset from last RX entry if patternOpt.bRxVal == 1
Bit mask to apply before comparison
Value to compare to

0: Keep frequency synth on after command
1: Turn frequency synth off after command

0: End operation after receiving a packet correctly
1: Go back to sync search after receiving a packet correctly

0: End operation after receiving a packet with CRC error
1: Go back to sync search after receiving a packet with CRC error

0: Do not check CRC
1: Check CRC

0: Fixed length
1: Receive length as first byte

0: No address check
1: Check address

0: Packet is received to the end if end trigger happens after sync is obtained
1: Packet reception is stopped if end trigger happens

0: Stop receiver and restart sync search on address mismatch
1: Receive packet and mark it as ignored on address mismatch
If 1, automatically discard ignored packets from RX queue
If 1, automatically discard packets with CRC error from RX queue
If 1, include the received header or length byte in the stored packet; otherwise discard it
If 1, include the received CRC field in the stored packet; otherwise discard it
If 1, append an RSSI byte to the packet in the RX queue
If 1, append a timestamp to the packet in the RX queue
If 1, append a status byte to the packet in the RX queue

Field.Description: RX configuration
Sync word to listen for

Packet length for fixed length, maximum packet length for variable length
0: Unlimited or unknown length
Address
Address (set equal to address0 to accept only one address. If 0xFF, accept 0x00 as well)

BitField.BitDescription: Condition for running next command: Rule for how to proceed
Number of skips + 1 if the rule involves skipping. 0: same, 1: next, 2: skip next, ...

0: Keep synth running if command ends with channel Idle
1: Turn off synth if command ends with channel Idle

0: Keep synth running if command ends with channel Busy
1: Turn off synth if command ends with channel Busy
If 1, enable RSSI as a criterion
If 1, enable correlation as a criterion

0: Busy if either RSSI or correlation indicates Busy
1: Busy if both RSSI and correlation indicates Busy

0: Continue carrier sense on channel Busy
1: End carrier sense on channel Busy
For an RX command, the receiver will continue when carrier sense ends, but it will then not end if channel goes Idle

0: Continue on channel Idle
1: End on channel Idle

0: Timeout with channel state Invalid treated as Busy
1: Timeout with channel state Invalid treated as Idle

Field.Description: RSSI threshold

Number of consecutive RSSI measurements below the threshold needed before the channel is
  declared Idle

Number of consecutive RSSI measurements above the threshold needed before the channel is
  declared Busy
Number of RAT ticks for a correlation observation periods

BitField.BitDescription: Number of subsequent correlation tops with maximum corrPeriod RAT ticks between them needed to go from Idle to Invalid
Number of subsequent correlation tops with maximum corrPeriod RAT ticks between them needed to go from Invalid to Busy

1: A trigger in the past is triggered as soon as possible

The trigger number of the CMD_TRIGGER command that triggers this action

0: A trigger in the past is never triggered, or for start of commands, give an error
1: A trigger in the past is triggered as soon as possible

Field.Description: Identification of the trigger that starts the operation

BitField.BitDescription: Condition for running next command: Rule for how to proceed
Number of skips + 1 if the rule involves skipping. 0: same, 1: next, 2: skip next, ...

0: FSK
1: GFSK
2: OOK
Others: Reserved
Deviation (specified in number of steps, with step size given by deviationStepSz)

Deviation step size
0: 250 Hz
1: 1000 Hz
2: 15.625 Hz
3: 62.5 Hz
Prescaler value
Rate word

0: Use automatic PDIF decimation
1: Force PDIF decimation to 0
3: Force PDIF decimation to 1
5: Force PDIF decimation to 2
Others: Reserved

Field.Description: Symbol rate setting
Receiver bandwidth

BitField.BitDescription:
0: 1 preamble bit
1–16: Number of preamble bytes
18, 20, ..., 30: Number of preamble bytes
31: 4 preamble bits
32: 32 preamble bytes
Others: Reserved

0: Send 0 as the first preamble bit
1: Send 1 as the first preamble bit
2: Send same first bit in preamble and sync word
3: Send different first bit in preamble and sync word
Number of sync word bits (8–32)

0: Use positive deviation for 1
1: Use positive deviation for 0

0: Least significant bit transmitted first
1: Most significant bit transmitted first

Select coding
0: Uncoded binary modulation
10: Manchester coded binary modulation
Others: Reserved

0: No whitening
1: CC1101/CC2500 compatible whitening
2: PN9 whitening without byte reversal
3: Reserved
4: No whitener, 32-bit IEEE 802.15.4g compatible CRC
5: IEEE 802.15.4g compatible whitener and 32-bit CRC
6: No whitener, dynamically IEEE 802.15.4g compatible 16-bit or 32-bit CRC
7: Dynamically IEEE 802.15.4g compatible whitener and 16-bit or 32-bit CRC

0x00: Differential mode
0x01: Single-ended mode RFP
0x02: Single-ended mode RFN
0x05 Single-ended mode RFP with external frontend control on RF pins (RFN and RXTX)
0x06 Single-ended mode RFN with external frontend control on RF pins (RFP and RXTX)
Others: Reserved

0: Internal bias
1: External bias

0x00: Write analog configuration.
Required first time after boot and when changing frequency band or front-end configuration
0x2D: Keep analog configuration.
May be used after standby or when changing mode with the same frequency band and front-end configuration
Others: Reserved

0: Power up frequency synth
1: Do not power up frequency synth

0: Normal synth mode
1: Narrow-band synth mode

Field.Description: Configuration options
Transmit power

Pointer to a list of hardware and configuration registers to override. If NULL, no
  override is used.

Field.Description: Configuration options
Transmit power

Pointer to a list of hardware and configuration registers to override. If NULL, no
  override is used.

Center frequency of the frequency band used, in MHz; used for calculating some internal TX and RX parameters.
  For a single channel RF system, this should be set equal to the RF frequency used.
  For a multi channel RF system (e.g. frequency hopping spread spectrum), this should be set equal
  to the center frequency of the frequency band used.

Intermediate frequency to use for RX, in MHz on 4.12 signed format. TX will use same intermediate frequency if supported, otherwise 0.
0x8000: Use default.
LO frequency divider setting to use. Supported values: 0, 2, 4, 5, 6, 10, 12, 15, and 30

Command.Description: Proprietary Mode Receive Command with Sniff Mode

Field.Description: The command ID number 0x3808

An integer telling the status of the command. This value is
  updated by the radio CPU during operation and may be read by the
  system CPU at any time.
Pointer to the next operation to run after this operation is done
Absolute or relative start time (depending on the value of startTrigger)

BitField.BitDescription: The type of trigger

0: No alternative trigger command
1: CMD_TRIGGER can be used as an alternative trigger
The trigger number of the CMD_TRIGGER command that triggers this action

0: A trigger in the past is never triggered, or for start of commands, give an error
1: A trigger in the past is triggered as soon as possible

Field.Description: Identification of the trigger that starts the operation

BitField.BitDescription: Condition for running next command: Rule for how to proceed
Number of skips + 1 if the rule involves skipping. 0: same, 1: next, 2: skip next, ...

0: Keep frequency synth on after command
1: Turn frequency synth off after command

0: End operation after receiving a packet correctly
1: Go back to sync search after receiving a packet correctly

0: End operation after receiving a packet with CRC error
1: Go back to sync search after receiving a packet with CRC error

0: Do not check CRC
1: Check CRC

0: Fixed length
1: Receive length as first byte

0: No address check
1: Check address

0: Packet is received to the end if end trigger happens after sync is obtained
1: Packet reception is stopped if end trigger happens

0: Stop receiver and restart sync search on address mismatch
1: Receive packet and mark it as ignored on address mismatch
If 1, automatically discard ignored packets from RX queue
If 1, automatically discard packets with CRC error from RX queue
If 1, include the received header or length byte in the stored packet; otherwise discard it
If 1, include the received CRC field in the stored packet; otherwise discard it
If 1, append an RSSI byte to the packet in the RX queue
If 1, append a timestamp to the packet in the RX queue
If 1, append a status byte to the packet in the RX queue

Field.Description: RX configuration
Sync word to listen for

Packet length for fixed length, maximum packet length for variable length
0: Unlimited or unknown length
Address
Address (set equal to address0 to accept only one address. If 0xFF, accept 0x00 as well)

BitField.BitDescription: The type of trigger

0: No alternative trigger command
1: CMD_TRIGGER can be used as an alternative trigger
The trigger number of the CMD_TRIGGER command that triggers this action

0: A trigger in the past is never triggered, or for start of commands, give an error
1: A trigger in the past is triggered as soon as possible

Field.Description: Trigger classifier for ending the operation
Time used together with endTrigger for ending the operation
Pointer to receive queue
Pointer to output structure

BitField.BitDescription: If 1, enable RSSI as a criterion
If 1, enable correlation as a criterion

0: Busy if either RSSI or correlation indicates Busy
1: Busy if both RSSI and correlation indicates Busy

0: Continue carrier sense on channel Busy
1: End carrier sense on channel Busy
For an RX command, the receiver will continue when carrier sense ends, but it will then not end if channel goes Idle

0: Continue on channel Idle
1: End on channel Idle

0: Timeout with channel state Invalid treated as Busy
1: Timeout with channel state Invalid treated as Idle

Field.Description: RSSI threshold

Number of consecutive RSSI measurements below the threshold needed before the channel is
  declared Idle

Number of consecutive RSSI measurements above the threshold needed before the channel is
  declared Busy
Number of RAT ticks for a correlation observation periods

BitField.BitDescription: Number of subsequent correlation tops with maximum corrPeriod RAT ticks between them needed to go from Idle to Invalid
Number of subsequent correlation tops with maximum corrPeriod RAT ticks between them needed to go from Invalid to Busy
The type of trigger

0: No alternative trigger command
1: CMD_TRIGGER can be used as an alternative trigger
The trigger number of the CMD_TRIGGER command that triggers this action

0: A trigger in the past is never triggered, or for start of commands, give an error
1: A trigger in the past is triggered as soon as possible

Field.Description: Trigger classifier for ending the carrier sense
Time used together with csEndTrigger for ending the operation
